7528  double B1 = 0.0;
7529  double B3 = 0.0;
7530 };
7531 
7543 class WdfParallelAdaptor : public WdfAdaptorBase
7544 {
7545 public:
7546  WdfParallelAdaptor() {}
7547  virtual ~WdfParallelAdaptor() {}
7548 
7550  virtual double getR2()
7551  {
7552  double componentConductance = 0.0;
7553  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7554  componentConductance = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getComponentConductance();
7555 
7556  // --- 1 / (sum of admittances)
7557  R2 = 1.0 / ((1.0 / R1) + componentConductance);
7558  return R2;
7559  }
7560 
7562  virtual void initialize(double _R1)
7563  {
7564  // --- save R1
7565  R1 = _R1;
7566 
7567  double G1 = 1.0 / R1;
7568  double componentConductance = 0.0;
7569  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7570  componentConductance = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getComponentConductance();
7571 
7572  // --- calculate B coeff
7573  A = G1 / (G1 + componentConductance);
7574 
7575  // --- now, do we init our downstream??
7576  if (getPort2_CompAdaptor())
7577  getPort2_CompAdaptor()->initialize(getR2());
7578 
7579  // --- not used in this implementation but saving for extended use
7580  R3 = 1.0/ componentConductance;
7581  }
7582 
7584  virtual void setInput1(double _in1)
7585  {
7586  // --- save
7587  in1 = _in1;
7588 
7589  // --- read component
7590  N2 = 0.0;
7591  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7592  N2 = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getOutput();
7593 
7594  // --- form output
7595  out2 = N2 - A*(-in1 + N2);
7596 
7597  // --- deliver downstream
7598  if (getPort2_CompAdaptor())
7599  getPort2_CompAdaptor()->setInput1(out2);
7600  }
7601 
7603  virtual void setInput2(double _in2)
7604  {
7605  // --- save
7606  in2 = _in2;
7607 
7608  // --- calc N1
7609  N1 = in2 - A*(-in1 + N2);
7610 
7611  // --- calc out1
7612  out1 = -in1 + N2 + N1;
7613 
7614  // --- deliver upstream
7615  if (getPort1_CompAdaptor())
7616  getPort1_CompAdaptor()->setInput2(out1);
7617 
7618  // --- set component state
7619  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7620  getPort3_CompAdaptor()->setInput(N1);
7621  }
7622 
7624  virtual void setInput3(double _in3) { }
7625 
7627  virtual double getOutput1() { return out1; }
7628 
7630  virtual double getOutput2() { return out2; }
7631 
7633  virtual double getOutput3() { return out3; }
7634 
7635 private:
7636  double N1 = 0.0;
7637  double N2 = 0.0;
7638  double A = 0.0;
7639 };
7640 
7641 
7653 class WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor : public WdfAdaptorBase
7654 {
7655 public:
7656  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor() {}
7657  virtual ~WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor() {}
7658 
7660  virtual double getR2()
7661  {
7662  double componentConductance = 0.0;
7663  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7664  componentConductance = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getComponentConductance();
7665 
7666  // --- 1 / (sum of admittances)
7667  R2 = 1.0 / ((1.0 / R1) + componentConductance);
7668  return R2;
7669  }
7670 
7672  virtual void initialize(double _R1)
7673  {
7674  // --- save R1
7675  R1 = _R1;
7676 
7677  double G1 = 1.0 / R1;
7678  if (terminalResistance <= 0.0)
7679  terminalResistance = 1e-15;
7680 
7681  double G2 = 1.0 / terminalResistance;
7682  double componentConductance = 0.0;
7683  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7684  componentConductance = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getComponentConductance();
7685 
7686  A1 = 2.0*G1 / (G1 + componentConductance + G2);
7687  A3 = openTerminalResistance ? 0.0 : 2.0*G2 / (G1 + componentConductance + G2);
7688 
7689  // --- init downstream
7690  if (getPort2_CompAdaptor())
7691  getPort2_CompAdaptor()->initialize(getR2());
7692 
7693  // --- not used in this implementation but saving for extended use
7694  R3 = 1.0 / componentConductance;
7695  }
7696 
7698  virtual void setInput1(double _in1)
7699  {
7700  // --- save
7701  in1 = _in1;
7702 
7703  N2 = 0.0;
7704  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7705  N2 = getPort3_CompAdaptor()->getOutput();
7706 
7707  // --- form N1
7708  N1 = -A1*(-in1 + N2) + N2 - A3*N2;
7709 
7710  // --- form output1
7711  out1 = -in1 + N2 + N1;
7712 
7713  // --- deliver upstream to input2
7714  if (getPort1_CompAdaptor())
7715  getPort1_CompAdaptor()->setInput2(out1);
7716 
7717  // --- calc out2 y(n)
7718  out2 = N2 + N1;
7719 
7720  // --- set component state
7721  if (getPort3_CompAdaptor())
7722  getPort3_CompAdaptor()->setInput(N1);
7723  }
7724 
7726  virtual void setInput2(double _in2){ in2 = _in2;}
7727 
7729  virtual void setInput3(double _in3) { }
7730 
7732  virtual double getOutput1() { return out1; }
7733 
7735  virtual double getOutput2() { return out2; }
7736 
7738  virtual double getOutput3() { return out3; }
7739 
7740 private:
7741  double N1 = 0.0;
7742  double N2 = 0.0;
7743  double A1 = 0.0;
7744  double A3 = 0.0;
7745 };
7746 
7747 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ //
7748 // --- WDF Ladder Filter Design Examples --------------------------------------- //
7749 // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ //
7750 //
7751 // --- 3rd order Butterworth LPF designed with Elsie www.TonneSoftware.comm
7752 //
7753 /*
7754  3rd Order Inductor-Leading LPF
7755 
7756  Rs = Rload = 600 ohms
7757 
7758  Series(L1) -> Parallel(C1) -> Series(L2)
7759 
7760  --L1-- | --L2--
7761  C1
7762  |
7763 
7764  fc = 1kHz
7765  L1 = 95.49e-3;
7766  C1 = 0.5305e-6;
7767  L2 = 95.49e-3;
7768 
7769  fc = 10kHz
7770  L1 = 9.549e-3;
7771  C1 = 0.05305e-6;
7772  L2 = 9.549e-3;
7773 */
7774 
7793 class WDFButterLPF3 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
7794 {
7795 public:
7796  WDFButterLPF3(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
7797  ~WDFButterLPF3(void) {} /* D-TOR */
7798 
7800  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
7801  {
7802  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
7803  seriesAdaptor_L1.reset(_sampleRate);
7804  parallelAdaptor_C1.reset(_sampleRate);
7805  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.reset(_sampleRate);
7806 
7807  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
7808  seriesAdaptor_L1.initializeAdaptorChain();
7809  return true;
7810  }
7811 
7813  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
7814 
7820  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
7821  {
7822  // --- push audio sample into series L1
7823  seriesAdaptor_L1.setInput1(xn);
7824 
7825  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
7826  return seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.getOutput2();
7827  }
7828 
7830  void createWDF()
7831  {
7832  // --- actual component values fc = 1kHz
7833  double L1_value = 95.49e-3; // 95.5 mH
7834  double C1_value = 0.5305e-6; // 0.53 uF
7835  double L2_value = 95.49e-3; // 95.5 mH
7836 
7837  // --- set adapter components
7838  seriesAdaptor_L1.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L1_value);
7839  parallelAdaptor_C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::C, C1_value);
7840  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L2_value);
7841 
7842  // --- connect adapters
7843  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1, &parallelAdaptor_C1);
7844  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_C1, &seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2);
7845 
7846  // --- set source resistance
7847  seriesAdaptor_L1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // --- Rs = 600
7848 
7849  // --- set terminal resistance
7850  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setTerminalResistance(600.0); // --- Rload = 600
7851  }
7852 
7853 protected:
7854  // --- three adapters
7855  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1;
7856  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_C1;
7857  WdfSeriesTerminatedAdaptor seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2;
7858 };
7859 
7879 class WDFTunableButterLPF3 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
7880 {
7881 public:
7882  WDFTunableButterLPF3(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
7883  ~WDFTunableButterLPF3(void) {} /* D-TOR */
7884 
7886  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
7887  {
7888  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
7889  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
7890  seriesAdaptor_L1.reset(_sampleRate);
7891  parallelAdaptor_C1.reset(_sampleRate);
7892  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.reset(_sampleRate);
7893 
7894  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
7895  seriesAdaptor_L1.initializeAdaptorChain();
7896  return true;
7897  }
7898 
7900  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
7901 
7907  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
7908  {
7909  // --- push audio sample into series L1
7910  seriesAdaptor_L1.setInput1(xn);
7911 
7912  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
7913  return seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.getOutput2();
7914  }
7915 
7917  void createWDF()
7918  {
7919  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc = 1Hz
7920  seriesAdaptor_L1.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L1_norm);
7921  parallelAdaptor_C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::C, C1_norm);
7922  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, L2_norm);
7923 
7924  // --- connect adapters
7925  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1, &parallelAdaptor_C1);
7926  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_C1, &seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2);
7927 
7928  // --- set source resistance
7929  seriesAdaptor_L1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // --- Rs = 600
7930 
7931  // --- set terminal resistance
7932  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setTerminalResistance(600.0); // --- Rload = 600
7933  }
7934 
7936  void setUsePostWarping(bool b) { useFrequencyWarping = b; }
7937 
7939  void setFilterFc(double fc_Hz)
7940  {
7941  if (useFrequencyWarping)
7942  {
7943  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
7944  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
7945  }
7946 
7947  seriesAdaptor_L1.setComponentValue(L1_norm / fc_Hz);
7948  parallelAdaptor_C1.setComponentValue(C1_norm / fc_Hz);
7949  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2.setComponentValue(L2_norm / fc_Hz);
7950  }
7951 
7952 protected:
7953  // --- three adapters
7954  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1;
7955  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_C1;
7956  WdfSeriesTerminatedAdaptor seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L2;
7957 
7958  double L1_norm = 95.493; // 95.5 mH
7959  double C1_norm = 530.516e-6; // 0.53 uF
7960  double L2_norm = 95.493; // 95.5 mH
7961 
7962  bool useFrequencyWarping = false;
7963  double sampleRate = 1.0;
7964 };
7965 
7984 class WDFBesselBSF3 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
7985 {
7986 public:
7987  WDFBesselBSF3(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
7988  ~WDFBesselBSF3(void) {} /* D-TOR */
7989 
7991  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
7992  {
7993  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
7994  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.reset(_sampleRate);
7995  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.reset(_sampleRate);
7996  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.reset(_sampleRate);
7997 
7998  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
7999  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.initializeAdaptorChain();
8000 
8001  return true;
8002  }
8003 
8005  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8006 
8012  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8013  {
8014  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8015  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setInput1(xn);
8016 
8017  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8018  return seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.getOutput2();
8019  }
8020 
8022  void createWDF()
8023  {
8024  // --- set component values
8025  // --- fo = 5kHz
8026  // BW = 2kHz or Q = 2.5
8027  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 16.8327e-3, 0.060193e-6); /* L, C */
8028  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 49.1978e-3, 0.02059e-6); /* L, C */
8029  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 2.57755e-3, 0.393092e-6); /* L, C */
8030 
8031  // --- connect adapters
8032  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1C1, &parallelAdaptor_L2C2);
8033  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_L2C2, &seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3);
8034 
8035  // --- set source resistance
8036  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // Ro = 600
8037 
8038  // --- set terminal resistance
8039  seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3.setTerminalResistance(600.0);
8040  }
8041 
8042 protected:
8043  // --- three adapters
8044  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1C1;
8045  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_L2C2;
8046  WdfSeriesTerminatedAdaptor seriesTerminatedAdaptor_L3C3;
8047 };
8048 
8049 
8068 class WDFConstKBPF6 : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8069 {
8070 public:
8071  WDFConstKBPF6(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8072  ~WDFConstKBPF6(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8073 
8075  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8076  {
8077  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8078  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.reset(_sampleRate);
8079  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.reset(_sampleRate);
8080 
8081  seriesAdaptor_L3C3.reset(_sampleRate);
8082  parallelAdaptor_L4C4.reset(_sampleRate);
8083 
8084  seriesAdaptor_L5C5.reset(_sampleRate);
8085  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.reset(_sampleRate);
8086 
8087  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8088  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.initializeAdaptorChain();
8089  return true;
8090  }
8091 
8093  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8094 
8100  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8101  {
8102  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8103  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setInput1(xn);
8104 
8105  // --- output is at terminated L6C6 output2
8106  double output = parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.getOutput2();
8107 
8108  return output;
8109  }
8110 
8112  void createWDF()
8113  {
8114  // --- fo = 5kHz
8115  // BW = 2kHz or Q = 2.5
8116  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 47.7465e-3, 0.02122e-6);
8117  parallelAdaptor_L2C2.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 3.81972e-3, 0.265258e-6);
8118 
8119  seriesAdaptor_L3C3.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 95.493e-3, 0.01061e-6);
8120  parallelAdaptor_L4C4.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 3.81972e-3, 0.265258e-6);
8121 
8122  seriesAdaptor_L5C5.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 95.493e-3, 0.01061e-6);
8123  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.setComponent(wdfComponent::parallelLC, 7.63944e-3, 0.132629e-6);
8124 
8125  // --- connect adapters
8126  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L1C1, &parallelAdaptor_L2C2);
8127  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_L2C2, &seriesAdaptor_L3C3);
8128  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L3C3, &parallelAdaptor_L4C4);
8129  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&parallelAdaptor_L4C4, &seriesAdaptor_L5C5);
8130  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_L5C5, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6);
8131 
8132  // --- set source resistance
8133  seriesAdaptor_L1C1.setSourceResistance(600.0); // Ro = 600
8134 
8135  // --- set terminal resistance
8136  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6.setTerminalResistance(600.0);
8137  }
8138 
8139 protected:
8140  // --- six adapters
8141  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L1C1;
8142  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_L2C2;
8143 
8144  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L3C3;
8145  WdfParallelAdaptor parallelAdaptor_L4C4;
8146 
8147  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_L5C5;
8148  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L6C6;
8149 };
8150 
8151 
8163 struct WDFParameters
8164 {
8165  WDFParameters() {}
8167  WDFParameters& operator=(const WDFParameters& params)
8168  {
8169  if (this == &params)
8170  return *this;
8171 
8172  fc = params.fc;
8173  Q = params.Q;
8174  boostCut_dB = params.boostCut_dB;
8175  frequencyWarping = params.frequencyWarping;
8176  return *this;
8177  }
8178 
8179  // --- individual parameters
8180  double fc = 100.0;
8181  double Q = 0.707;
8182  double boostCut_dB = 0.0;
8183  bool frequencyWarping = true;
8184 };
8185 
8203 class WDFIdealRLCLPF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8204 {
8205 public:
8206  WDFIdealRLCLPF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8207  ~WDFIdealRLCLPF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8208 
8210  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8211  {
8212  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8213 
8214  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8215  seriesAdaptor_RL.reset(_sampleRate);
8216  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.reset(_sampleRate);
8217 
8218  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8219  seriesAdaptor_RL.initializeAdaptorChain();
8220  return true;
8221  }
8222 
8224  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8225 
8231  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8232  {
8233  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8234  seriesAdaptor_RL.setInput1(xn);
8235 
8236  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8237  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8238  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8239  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.getOutput2();
8240  }
8241 
8243  void createWDF()
8244  {
8245  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8246  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8247  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8248  // L = 2.533e-2
8249  // R = 2.251131 e2
8250  seriesAdaptor_RL.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesRL, 2.251131e2, 2.533e-2);
8251  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.setComponent(wdfComponent::C, 1.0e-6);
8252 
8253  // --- connect adapters
8254  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_RL, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C);
8255 
8256  // --- set source resistance
8257  seriesAdaptor_RL.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8258 
8259  // --- set open ckt termination
8260  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8261  }
8262 
8267  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8268 
8273  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8274  {
8275  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8276  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8277  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8278  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8279  {
8280  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8281  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8282 
8283  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8284  {
8285  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8286  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8287  }
8288 
8289  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8290  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8291 
8292  seriesAdaptor_RL.setComponentValue_RL(resistorValue, inductorValue);
8293  seriesAdaptor_RL.initializeAdaptorChain();
8294  }
8295  }
8296 
8297 protected:
8298  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8299 
8300  // --- adapters
8301  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_RL;
8302  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_C;
8303 
8304  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8305 
8306 };
8307 
8325 class WDFIdealRLCHPF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8326 {
8327 public:
8328  WDFIdealRLCHPF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8329  ~WDFIdealRLCHPF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8330 
8332  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8333  {
8334  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8335  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8336  seriesAdaptor_RC.reset(_sampleRate);
8337  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.reset(_sampleRate);
8338 
8339  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8340  seriesAdaptor_RC.initializeAdaptorChain();
8341  return true;
8342  }
8343 
8345  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8346 
8352  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8353  {
8354  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8355  seriesAdaptor_RC.setInput1(xn);
8356 
8357  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8358  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8359  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8360  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.getOutput2();
8361  }
8362 
8364  void createWDF()
8365  {
8366  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8367  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8368  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8369  // L = 2.533e-2
8370  // R = 2.251131 e2
8371  seriesAdaptor_RC.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesRC, 2.251131e2, 1.0e-6);
8372  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.setComponent(wdfComponent::L, 2.533e-2);
8373 
8374  // --- connect adapters
8375  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_RC, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L);
8376 
8377  // --- set source resistance
8378  seriesAdaptor_RC.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8379 
8380  // --- set open ckt termination
8381  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8382  }
8383 
8388  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8389 
8394  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8395  {
8396  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8397  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8398  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8399  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8400  {
8401  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8402  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8403 
8404  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8405  {
8406  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8407  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8408  }
8409 
8410  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8411  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8412 
8413  seriesAdaptor_RC.setComponentValue_RC(resistorValue, 1.0e-6);
8414  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L.setComponentValue(inductorValue);
8415  seriesAdaptor_RC.initializeAdaptorChain();
8416  }
8417  }
8418 
8419 
8420 protected:
8421  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8422 
8423  // --- three
8424  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_RC;
8425  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_L;
8426 
8427  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8428 };
8429 
8447 class WDFIdealRLCBPF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8448 {
8449 public:
8450  WDFIdealRLCBPF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8451  ~WDFIdealRLCBPF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8452 
8454  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8455  {
8456  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8457  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8458  seriesAdaptor_LC.reset(_sampleRate);
8459  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.reset(_sampleRate);
8460 
8461  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8462  seriesAdaptor_LC.initializeAdaptorChain();
8463  return true;
8464  }
8465 
8467  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8468 
8474  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8475  {
8476  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8477  seriesAdaptor_LC.setInput1(xn);
8478 
8479  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8480  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8481  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8482  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.getOutput2();
8483  }
8484 
8486  void createWDF()
8487  {
8488  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8489  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8490  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8491  // L = 2.533e-2
8492  // R = 2.251131 e2
8493  seriesAdaptor_LC.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 2.533e-2, 1.0e-6);
8494  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.setComponent(wdfComponent::R, 2.251131e2);
8495 
8496  // --- connect adapters
8497  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_LC, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R);
8498 
8499  // --- set source resistance
8500  seriesAdaptor_LC.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8501 
8502  // --- set open ckt termination
8503  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8504  }
8505 
8510  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8511 
8516  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8517  {
8518  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8519  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8520  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8521  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8522  {
8523  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8524  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8525 
8526  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8527  {
8528  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8529  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8530  }
8531 
8532  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8533  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8534 
8535  seriesAdaptor_LC.setComponentValue_LC(inductorValue, 1.0e-6);
8536  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R.setComponentValue(resistorValue);
8537  seriesAdaptor_LC.initializeAdaptorChain();
8538  }
8539  }
8540 
8541 protected:
8542  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8543 
8544  // --- adapters
8545  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_LC;
8546  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_R;
8547 
8548  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8549 };
8550 
8551 
8569 class WDFIdealRLCBSF : public IAudioSignalProcessor
8570 {
8571 public:
8572  WDFIdealRLCBSF(void) { createWDF(); } /* C-TOR */
8573  ~WDFIdealRLCBSF(void) {} /* D-TOR */
8574 
8576  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
8577  {
8578  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
8579  // --- rest WDF components (flush state registers)
8580  seriesAdaptor_R.reset(_sampleRate);
8581  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.reset(_sampleRate);
8582 
8583  // --- intialize the chain of adapters
8584  seriesAdaptor_R.initializeAdaptorChain();
8585  return true;
8586  }
8587 
8589  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
8590 
8596  virtual double processAudioSample(double xn)
8597  {
8598  // --- push audio sample into series L1
8599  seriesAdaptor_R.setInput1(xn);
8600 
8601  // --- output is at terminated L2's output2
8602  // note compensation scaling by -6dB = 0.5
8603  // because of WDF assumption about Rs and Rload
8604  return 0.5*parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.getOutput2();
8605  }
8606 
8608  void createWDF()
8609  {
8610  // --- create components, init to noramlized values fc =
8611  // initial values for fc = 1kHz Q = 0.707
8612  // Holding C Constant at 1e-6
8613  // L = 2.533e-2
8614  // R = 2.251131 e2
8615  seriesAdaptor_R.setComponent(wdfComponent::R, 2.533e-2);
8616  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.setComponent(wdfComponent::seriesLC, 2.533e-2, 1.0e-6);
8617 
8618  // --- connect adapters
8619  WdfAdaptorBase::connectAdaptors(&seriesAdaptor_R, &parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC);
8620 
8621  // --- set source resistance
8622  seriesAdaptor_R.setSourceResistance(0.0); // --- Rs = 600
8623 
8624  // --- set open ckt termination
8625  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.setOpenTerminalResistance(true);
8626  }
8627 
8632  WDFParameters getParameters() { return wdfParameters; }
8633 
8638  void setParameters(const WDFParameters& _wdfParameters)
8639  {
8640  if (_wdfParameters.fc != wdfParameters.fc ||
8641  _wdfParameters.Q != wdfParameters.Q ||
8642  _wdfParameters.boostCut_dB != wdfParameters.boostCut_dB ||
8643  _wdfParameters.frequencyWarping != wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8644  {
8645  wdfParameters = _wdfParameters;
8646  double fc_Hz = wdfParameters.fc;
8647 
8648  if (wdfParameters.frequencyWarping)
8649  {
8650  double arg = (kPi*fc_Hz) / sampleRate;
8651  fc_Hz = fc_Hz*(tan(arg) / arg);
8652  }
8653 
8654  double inductorValue = 1.0 / (1.0e-6 * pow((2.0*kPi*fc_Hz), 2.0));
8655  double resistorValue = (1.0 / wdfParameters.Q)*(pow(inductorValue / 1.0e-6, 0.5));
8656 
8657  seriesAdaptor_R.setComponentValue(resistorValue);
8658  parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC.setComponentValue_LC(inductorValue, 1.0e-6);
8659  seriesAdaptor_R.initializeAdaptorChain();
8660  }
8661  }
8662 
8663 protected:
8664  WDFParameters wdfParameters;
8665 
8666  // --- adapters
8667  WdfSeriesAdaptor seriesAdaptor_R;
8668  WdfParallelTerminatedAdaptor parallelTerminatedAdaptor_LC;
8669 
8670  double sampleRate = 1.0;
8671 };
8672 
8673 
8674 // ------------------------------------------------------------------ //
8675 // --- OBJECTS REQUIRING FFTW --------------------------------------- //
8676 // ------------------------------------------------------------------ //
8677 
8691 enum class windowType {kNoWindow, kRectWindow, kHannWindow, kBlackmanHarrisWindow, kHammingWindow };
8692 
8703 inline std::unique_ptr<double[]> makeWindow(unsigned int windowLength, unsigned int hopSize, windowType window, double& gainCorrectionValue)
8704 {
8705  std::unique_ptr<double[]> windowBuffer;
8706  windowBuffer.reset(new double[windowLength]);
8707 
8708  if (!windowBuffer) return nullptr;
8709 
8710  double overlap = hopSize > 0.0 ? 1.0 - (double)hopSize / (double)windowLength : 0.0;
8711  gainCorrectionValue = 0.0;
8712 
8713  for (int n = 0; n < windowLength; n++)
8714  {
8715  if (window == windowType::kRectWindow)
8716  {
8717  if (n >= 1 && n <= windowLength - 1)
8718  windowBuffer[n] = 1.0;
8719  }
8720  else if (window == windowType::kHammingWindow)
8721  {
8722  windowBuffer[n] = 0.54 - 0.46*cos((n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength));
8723  }
8724  else if (window == windowType::kHannWindow)
8725  {
8726  windowBuffer[n] = 0.5 * (1 - cos((n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength)));
8727  }
8728  else if (window == windowType::kBlackmanHarrisWindow)
8729  {
8730  windowBuffer[n] = (0.42323 - (0.49755*cos((n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength))) + 0.07922*cos((2 * n*2.0*kPi) / (windowLength)));
8731  }
8732  else if (window == windowType::kNoWindow)
8733  {
8734  windowBuffer[n] = 1.0;
8735  }
8736 
8737  gainCorrectionValue += windowBuffer[n];
8738  }
8739 
8740  // --- calculate gain correction factor
8741  if (window != windowType::kNoWindow)
8742  gainCorrectionValue = (1.0 - overlap) / gainCorrectionValue;
8743  else
8744  gainCorrectionValue = 1.0 / gainCorrectionValue;
8745 
8746  return windowBuffer;
8747 }
8748 
8749 // --- FFTW ---
8750 #ifdef HAVE_FFTW
8751 #include "fftw3.h"
8752 
8770 class FastFFT
8771 {
8772 public:
8773  FastFFT() {} /* C-TOR */
8774  ~FastFFT() {
8775  if (windowBuffer) delete[] windowBuffer;
8776  destroyFFTW();
8777  } /* D-TOR */
8778 
8780  void initialize(unsigned int _frameLength, windowType _window);
8781 
8783  void destroyFFTW();
8784 
8786  fftw_complex* doFFT(double* inputReal, double* inputImag = nullptr);
8787 
8789  fftw_complex* doInverseFFT(double* inputReal, double* inputImag);
8790 
8792  unsigned int getFrameLength() { return frameLength; }
8793 
8794 protected:
8795  // --- setup FFTW
8796  fftw_complex* fft_input = nullptr;
8797  fftw_complex* fft_result = nullptr;
8798  fftw_complex* ifft_input = nullptr;
8799  fftw_complex* ifft_result = nullptr;
8800  fftw_plan plan_forward = nullptr;
8801  fftw_plan plan_backward = nullptr;
8802 
8803  double* windowBuffer = nullptr;
8804  double windowGainCorrection = 1.0;
8805  windowType window = windowType::kHannWindow;
8806  unsigned int frameLength = 0;
8807 };
8808 
8809 
8829 class PhaseVocoder
8830 {
8831 public:
8832  PhaseVocoder() {} /* C-TOR */
8833  ~PhaseVocoder() {
8834  if (inputBuffer) delete[] inputBuffer;
8835  if (outputBuffer) delete[] outputBuffer;
8836  if (windowBuffer) delete[] windowBuffer;
8837  destroyFFTW();
8838  } /* D-TOR */
8839 
8841  void initialize(unsigned int _frameLength, unsigned int _hopSize, windowType _window);
8842 
8844  void destroyFFTW();
8845 
8847  double processAudioSample(double input, bool& fftReady);
8848 
8850  bool addZeroPad(unsigned int count);
8851 
8853  bool advanceAndCheckFFT();
8854 
8856  fftw_complex* getFFTData() { return fft_result; }
8857 
8859  fftw_complex* getIFFTData() { return ifft_result; }
8860 
8862  void doInverseFFT();
8863 
8865  void doOverlapAdd(double* outputData = nullptr, int length = 0);
8866 
8868  unsigned int getFrameLength() { return frameLength; }
8869 
8871  unsigned int getHopSize() { return hopSize; }
8872 
8874  double getOverlap() { return overlap; }
8875 
8877  // --- for fast convolution and other overlap-add algorithms
8878  // that are not hop-size dependent
8879  void setOverlapAddOnly(bool b){ bool overlapAddOnly = b; }
8880 
8881 protected:
8882  // --- setup FFTW
8883  fftw_complex* fft_input = nullptr;
8884  fftw_complex* fft_result = nullptr;
8885  fftw_complex* ifft_result = nullptr;
8886  fftw_plan plan_forward = nullptr;
8887  fftw_plan plan_backward = nullptr;
8888 
8889  // --- linear buffer for window
8890  double* windowBuffer = nullptr;
8891 
8892  // --- circular buffers for input and output
8893  double* inputBuffer = nullptr;
8894  double* outputBuffer = nullptr;
8895 
8896  // --- index and wrap masks for input and output buffers
8897  unsigned int inputWriteIndex = 0;
8898  unsigned int outputWriteIndex = 0;
8899  unsigned int inputReadIndex = 0;
8900  unsigned int outputReadIndex = 0;
8901  unsigned int wrapMask = 0;
8902  unsigned int wrapMaskOut = 0;
8903 
8904  // --- amplitude correction factor, aking into account both hopsize (overlap)
8905  // and the window power itself
8906  double windowHopCorrection = 1.0;
8907 
8908  // --- these allow a more robust combination of user interaction
8909  bool needInverseFFT = false;
8910  bool needOverlapAdd = false;
8911 
8912  // --- our window type; you can add more windows if you like
8913  windowType window = windowType::kHannWindow;
8914 
8915  // --- counters
8916  unsigned int frameLength = 0;
8917  unsigned int fftCounter = 0;
8918 
8919  // --- hop-size and overlap (mathematically related)
8920  unsigned int hopSize = 0;
8921  double overlap = 1.0;
8922 
8923  // --- flag for overlap-add algorithms that do not involve hop-size, other
8924  // than setting the overlap
8925  bool overlapAddOnly = false;
8926 
8927 };
8928 
8948 class FastConvolver
8949 {
8950 public:
8951  FastConvolver() {
8952  vocoder.setOverlapAddOnly(true);
8953  } /* C-TOR */
8954  ~FastConvolver() {
8955  if (filterIR)
8956  delete[] filterIR;
8957 
8958  if (filterFFT)
8959  fftw_free(filterFFT);
8960  } /* D-TOR */
8961 
8966  void initialize(unsigned int _filterImpulseLength)
8967  {
8968  if (filterImpulseLength == _filterImpulseLength)
8969  return;
8970 
8971  // --- setup a specialized vocoder with 50% hop size
8972  filterImpulseLength = _filterImpulseLength;
8973  vocoder.initialize(filterImpulseLength * 2, filterImpulseLength, windowType::kNoWindow);
8974 
8975  // --- initialize the FFT object for capturing the filter FFT
8976  filterFastFFT.initialize(filterImpulseLength * 2, windowType::kNoWindow);
8977 
8978  // --- array to hold the filter IR; this could be localized to the particular function that uses it
8979  if (filterIR)
8980  delete [] filterIR;
8981  filterIR = new double[filterImpulseLength * 2];
8982  memset(&filterIR[0], 0, filterImpulseLength * 2 * sizeof(double));
8983 
8984  // --- allocate the filter FFT arrays
8985  if(filterFFT)
8986  fftw_free(filterFFT);
8987 
8988  filterFFT = (fftw_complex*)fftw_malloc(sizeof(fftw_complex) * filterImpulseLength * 2);
8989 
8990  // --- reset
8991  inputCount = 0;
8992  }
8993 
8995  void setFilterIR(double* irBuffer)
8996  {
8997  if (!irBuffer) return;
8998 
8999  memset(&filterIR[0], 0, filterImpulseLength * 2 * sizeof(double));
9000 
9001  // --- copy over first half; filterIR len = filterImpulseLength * 2
9002  int m = 0;
9003  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < filterImpulseLength; i++)
9004  {
9005  filterIR[i] = irBuffer[i];
9006  }
9007 
9008  // --- take FFT of the h(n)
9009  fftw_complex* fftOfFilter = filterFastFFT.doFFT(&filterIR[0]);
9010 
9011  // --- copy the FFT into our local buffer for storage; also
9012  // we never want to hold a pointer to a FFT output
9013  // for more than one local function's worth
9014  // could replace with memcpy( )
9015  for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
9016  {
9017  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < filterImpulseLength * 2; j++)
9018  {
9019  filterFFT[j][i] = fftOfFilter[j][i];
9020  }
9021  }
9022  }
9023 
9025  double processAudioSample(double input)
9026  {
9027  bool fftReady = false;
9028  double output = 0.0;
9029 
9030  if (inputCount == filterImpulseLength)
9031  {
9032  fftReady = vocoder.addZeroPad(filterImpulseLength);
9033 
9034  if (fftReady) // should happen on time
9035  {
9036  // --- multiply our filter IR with the vocoder FFT
9037  fftw_complex* signalFFT = vocoder.getFFTData();
9038  if (signalFFT)
9039  {
9040  unsigned int fff = vocoder.getFrameLength();
9041 
9042  // --- complex multiply with FFT of IR
9043  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < filterImpulseLength * 2; i++)
9044  {
9045  // --- get real/imag parts of each FFT
9046  ComplexNumber signal(signalFFT[i][0], signalFFT[i][1]);
9047  ComplexNumber filter(filterFFT[i][0], filterFFT[i][1]);
9048 
9049  // --- use complex multiply function; this convolves in the time domain
9050  ComplexNumber product = complexMultiply(signal, filter);
9051 
9052  // --- overwrite the FFT bins
9053  signalFFT[i][0] = product.real;
9054  signalFFT[i][1] = product.imag;
9055  }
9056  }
9057  }
9058 
9059  // --- reset counter
9060  inputCount = 0;
9061  }
9062 
9063  // --- process next sample
9064  output = vocoder.processAudioSample(input, fftReady);
9065  inputCount++;
9066 
9067  return output;
9068  }
9069 
9071  unsigned int getFrameLength() { return vocoder.getFrameLength(); }
9072 
9074  unsigned int getFilterIRLength() { return filterImpulseLength; }
9075 
9076 protected:
9077  PhaseVocoder vocoder;
9078  FastFFT filterFastFFT;
9079  fftw_complex* filterFFT = nullptr;
9080  double* filterIR = nullptr;
9081  unsigned int inputCount = 0;
9082  unsigned int filterImpulseLength = 0;
9083 };
9084 
9085 // --- PSM Vocoder
9086 const unsigned int PSM_FFT_LEN = 4096;
9087 
9101 struct BinData
9102 {
9103  BinData() {}
9105  BinData& operator=(const BinData& params) // need this override for collections to work
9106  {
9107  if (this == &params)
9108  return *this;
9109 
9110  isPeak = params.isPeak;
9111  magnitude = params.magnitude;
9112  phi = params.phi;
9113 
9114  psi = params.psi;
9115  localPeakBin = params.localPeakBin;
9116  previousPeakBin = params.previousPeakBin;
9117  updatedPhase = params.updatedPhase;
9118 
9119  return *this;
9120  }
9121 
9123  void reset()
9124  {
9125  isPeak = false;
9126  magnitude = 0.0;
9127  phi = 0.0;
9128 
9129  psi = 0.0;
9130  localPeakBin = 0;
9131  previousPeakBin = -1; // -1 is flag
9132  updatedPhase = 0.0;
9133  }
9134 
9135  bool isPeak = false;
9136  double magnitude = 0.0;
9137  double phi = 0.0;
9138  double psi = 0.0;
9139  unsigned int localPeakBin = 0;
9140  int previousPeakBin = -1;
9141  double updatedPhase = 0.0;
9142 };
9143 
9155 struct PSMVocoderParameters
9156 {
9157  PSMVocoderParameters() {}
9159  PSMVocoderParameters& operator=(const PSMVocoderParameters& params) // need this override for collections to work
9160  {
9161  if (this == &params)
9162  return *this;
9163 
9164  pitchShiftSemitones = params.pitchShiftSemitones;
9165  enablePeakPhaseLocking = params.enablePeakPhaseLocking;
9166  enablePeakTracking = params.enablePeakTracking;
9167 
9168  return *this;
9169  }
9170 
9171  // --- params
9172  double pitchShiftSemitones = 0.0;
9173  bool enablePeakPhaseLocking = false;
9174  bool enablePeakTracking = false;
9175 };
9176 
9195 class PSMVocoder : public IAudioSignalProcessor
9196 {
9197 public:
9198  PSMVocoder() {
9199  vocoder.initialize(PSM_FFT_LEN, PSM_FFT_LEN/4, windowType::kHannWindow); // 75% overlap
9200  } /* C-TOR */
9201  ~PSMVocoder() {
9202  if (windowBuff) delete[] windowBuff;
9203  if (outputBuff) delete[] outputBuff;
9204 
9205  } /* D-TOR */
9206 
9208  virtual bool reset(double _sampleRate)
9209  {
9210  memset(&phi[0], 0, sizeof(double)*PSM_FFT_LEN);
9211  memset(&psi[0], 0, sizeof(double)* PSM_FFT_LEN);
9212  if(outputBuff)
9213  memset(outputBuff, 0, sizeof(double)*outputBufferLength);
9214 
9215  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9216  {
9217  binData[i].reset();
9218  binDataPrevious[i].reset();
9219 
9220  peakBins[i] = -1;
9221  peakBinsPrevious[i] = -1;
9222  }
9223 
9224  return true;
9225  }
9226 
9228  virtual bool canProcessAudioFrame() { return false; }
9229 
9231  void setPitchShift(double semitones)
9232  {
9233  // --- this is costly so only update when things changed
9234  double newAlpha = pow(2.0, semitones / 12.0);
9235  double newOutputBufferLength = round((1.0/newAlpha)*(double)PSM_FFT_LEN);
9236 
9237  // --- check for change
9238  if (newOutputBufferLength == outputBufferLength)
9239  return;
9240 
9241  // --- new stuff
9242  alphaStretchRatio = newAlpha;
9243  ha = hs / alphaStretchRatio;
9244 
9245  // --- set output resample buffer
9246  outputBufferLength = newOutputBufferLength;
9247 
9248  // --- create Hann window
9249  if (windowBuff) delete[] windowBuff;
9250  windowBuff = new double[outputBufferLength];
9251  windowCorrection = 0.0;
9252  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < outputBufferLength; i++)
9253  {
9254  windowBuff[i] = 0.5 * (1.0 - cos((i*2.0*kPi) / (outputBufferLength)));
9255  windowCorrection += windowBuff[i];
9256  }
9257  windowCorrection = 1.0 / windowCorrection;
9258 
9259  // --- create output buffer
9260  if (outputBuff) delete[] outputBuff;
9261  outputBuff = new double[outputBufferLength];
9262  memset(outputBuff, 0, sizeof(double)*outputBufferLength);
9263  }
9264 
9266  int findPreviousNearestPeak(int peakIndex)
9267  {
9268  if (peakBinsPrevious[0] == -1) // first run, there is no peak
9269  return -1;
9270 
9271  int delta = -1;
9272  int previousPeak = -1;
9273  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9274  {
9275  if (peakBinsPrevious[i] < 0)
9276  break;
9277 
9278  int dist = abs(peakIndex - peakBinsPrevious[i]);
9279  if (dist > PSM_FFT_LEN/4)
9280  break;
9281 
9282  if (i == 0)
9283  {
9284  previousPeak = i;
9285  delta = dist;
9286  }
9287  else if (dist < delta)
9288  {
9289  previousPeak = i;
9290  delta = dist;
9291  }
9292  }
9293 
9294  return previousPeak;
9295  }
9296 
9298  void findPeaksAndRegionsOfInfluence()
9299  {
9300  // --- FIND PEAKS --- //
9301  //
9302  // --- find local maxima in 4-sample window
9303  double localWindow[4] = { 0.0 };
9304  int m = 0;
9305  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9306  {
9307  if (i == 0)
9308  {
9309  localWindow[0] = 0.0;
9310  localWindow[1] = 0.0;
9311  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9312  localWindow[3] = binData[i + 2].magnitude;
9313  }
9314  else if (i == 1)
9315  {
9316  localWindow[0] = 0.0;
9317  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9318  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9319  localWindow[3] = binData[i + 2].magnitude;
9320  }
9321  else if (i == PSM_FFT_LEN - 1)
9322  {
9323  localWindow[0] = binData[i - 2].magnitude;
9324  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9325  localWindow[2] = 0.0;
9326  localWindow[3] = 0.0;
9327  }
9328  else if (i == PSM_FFT_LEN - 2)
9329  {
9330  localWindow[0] = binData[i - 2].magnitude;
9331  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9332  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9333  localWindow[3] = 0.0;
9334  }
9335  else
9336  {
9337  localWindow[0] = binData[i - 2].magnitude;
9338  localWindow[1] = binData[i - 1].magnitude;
9339  localWindow[2] = binData[i + 1].magnitude;
9340  localWindow[3] = binData[i + 2].magnitude;
9341  }
9342 
9343  // --- found peak bin!
9344  if (binData[i].magnitude > 0.00001 &&
9345  binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[0]
9346  && binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[1]
9347  && binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[2]
9348  && binData[i].magnitude > localWindow[3])
9349  {
9350  binData[i].isPeak = true;
9351  peakBins[m++] = i;
9352 
9353  // --- for peak bins, assume that it is part of a previous, moving peak
9354  if (parameters.enablePeakTracking)
9355  binData[i].previousPeakBin = findPreviousNearestPeak(i);
9356  else
9357  binData[i].previousPeakBin = -1;
9358  }
9359  }
9360 
9361  // --- assign peak bosses
9362  if (m > 0)
9363  {
9364  int n = 0;
9365  int bossPeakBin = peakBins[n];
9366  double nextPeak = peakBins[++n];
9367  int midBoundary = (nextPeak - (double)bossPeakBin) / 2.0 + bossPeakBin;
9368 
9369  if (nextPeak >= 0)
9370  {
9371  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9372  {
9373  if (i <= bossPeakBin)
9374  {
9375  binData[i].localPeakBin = bossPeakBin;
9376  }
9377  else if (i < midBoundary)
9378  {
9379  binData[i].localPeakBin = bossPeakBin;
9380  }
9381  else // > boundary, calc next set
9382  {
9383  bossPeakBin = nextPeak;
9384  nextPeak = peakBins[++n];
9385  if (nextPeak > bossPeakBin)
9386  midBoundary = (nextPeak - (double)bossPeakBin) / 2.0 + bossPeakBin;
9387  else // nextPeak == -1
9388  midBoundary = PSM_FFT_LEN;
9389 
9390  binData[i].localPeakBin = bossPeakBin;
9391  }
9392  }
9393  }
9394  }
9395  }
9396 
9402  virtual double processAudioSample(double input)
9403  {
9404  bool fftReady = false;
9405  double output = 0.0;
9406 
9407  // --- normal processing
9408  output = vocoder.processAudioSample(input, fftReady);
9409 
9410  // --- if FFT is here, GO!
9411  if (fftReady)
9412  {
9413  // --- get the FFT data
9414  fftw_complex* fftData = vocoder.getFFTData();
9415 
9416  if (parameters.enablePeakPhaseLocking)
9417  {
9418  // --- get the magnitudes for searching
9419  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9420  {
9421  binData[i].reset();
9422  peakBins[i] = -1;
9423 
9424  // --- store mag and phase
9425  binData[i].magnitude = getMagnitude(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9426  binData[i].phi = getPhase(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9427  }
9428 
9429  findPeaksAndRegionsOfInfluence();
9430 
9431  // --- each bin data should now know its local boss-peak
9432  //
9433  // --- now propagate phases accordingly
9434  //
9435  // FIRST: set PSI angles of bosses
9436  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9437  {
9438  double mag_k = binData[i].magnitude;
9439  double phi_k = binData[i].phi;
9440 
9441  // --- horizontal phase propagation
9442  //
9443  // --- omega_k = bin frequency(k)
9444  double omega_k = kTwoPi*i / PSM_FFT_LEN;
9445 
9446  // --- phase deviation is actual - expected phase
9447  // = phi_k -(phi(last frame) + wk*ha
9448  double phaseDev = phi_k - phi[i] - omega_k*ha;
9449 
9450  // --- unwrapped phase increment
9451  double deltaPhi = omega_k*ha + principalArg(phaseDev);
9452 
9453  // --- save for next frame
9454  phi[i] = phi_k;
9455 
9456  // --- if peak, assume it could have hopped from a different bin
9457  if (binData[i].isPeak)
9458  {
9459  // --- calculate new phase based on stretch factor; save phase for next time
9460  if(binData[i].previousPeakBin < 0)
9461  psi[i] = principalArg(psi[i] + deltaPhi * alphaStretchRatio);
9462  else
9463  psi[i] = principalArg(psi[binDataPrevious[i].previousPeakBin] + deltaPhi * alphaStretchRatio);
9464  }
9465 
9466  // --- save peak PSI (new angle)
9467  binData[i].psi = psi[i];
9468 
9469  // --- for IFFT
9470  binData[i].updatedPhase = binData[i].psi;
9471  }
9472 
9473  // --- now set non-peaks
9474  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9475  {
9476  if (!binData[i].isPeak)
9477  {
9478  int myPeakBin = binData[i].localPeakBin;
9479 
9480  double PSI_kp = binData[myPeakBin].psi;
9481  double phi_kp = binData[myPeakBin].phi;
9482 
9483  // --- save for next frame
9484  // phi[i] = binData[myPeakBin].phi;
9485 
9486  // --- calculate new phase, locked to boss peak
9487  psi[i] = principalArg(PSI_kp - phi_kp - binData[i].phi);
9488  binData[i].updatedPhase = psi[i];// principalArg(PSI_kp - phi_kp - binData[i].phi);
9489  }
9490  }
9491 
9492  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9493  {
9494  double mag_k = binData[i].magnitude;
9495 
9496  // --- convert back
9497  fftData[i][0] = mag_k*cos(binData[i].updatedPhase);
9498  fftData[i][1] = mag_k*sin(binData[i].updatedPhase);
9499 
9500  // --- save for next frame
9501  binDataPrevious[i] = binData[i];
9502  peakBinsPrevious[i] = peakBins[i];
9503 
9504  }
9505  }// end if peak locking
9506 
9507  else // ---> old school
9508  {
9509  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9510  {
9511  double mag_k = getMagnitude(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9512  double phi_k = getPhase(fftData[i][0], fftData[i][1]);
9513 
9514  // --- horizontal phase propagation
9515  //
9516  // --- omega_k = bin frequency(k)
9517  double omega_k = kTwoPi*i / PSM_FFT_LEN;
9518 
9519  // --- phase deviation is actual - expected phase
9520  // = phi_k -(phi(last frame) + wk*ha
9521  double phaseDev = phi_k - phi[i] - omega_k*ha;
9522 
9523  // --- unwrapped phase increment
9524  double deltaPhi = omega_k*ha + principalArg(phaseDev);
9525 
9526  // --- save for next frame
9527  phi[i] = phi_k;
9528 
9529  // --- calculate new phase based on stretch factor; save phase for next time
9530  psi[i] = principalArg(psi[i] + deltaPhi * alphaStretchRatio);
9531 
9532  // --- convert back
9533  fftData[i][0] = mag_k*cos(psi[i]);
9534  fftData[i][1] = mag_k*sin(psi[i]);
9535  }
9536  }
9537 
9538 
9539  // --- manually so the IFFT (OPTIONAL)
9540  vocoder.doInverseFFT();
9541 
9542  // --- can get the iFFT buffers
9543  fftw_complex* inv_fftData = vocoder.getIFFTData();
9544 
9545  // --- make copy (can speed this up)
9546  double ifft[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { 0.0 };
9547  for (int i = 0; i < PSM_FFT_LEN; i++)
9548  ifft[i] = inv_fftData[i][0];
9549 
9550  // --- resample the audio as if it were stretched
9551  resample(&ifft[0], outputBuff, PSM_FFT_LEN, outputBufferLength, interpolation::kLinear, windowCorrection, windowBuff);
9552 
9553  // --- overlap-add the interpolated buffer to complete the operation
9554  vocoder.doOverlapAdd(&outputBuff[0], outputBufferLength);
9555  }
9556 
9557  return output;
9558  }
9559 
9564  PSMVocoderParameters getParameters()
9565  {
9566  return parameters;
9567  }
9568 
9573  void setParameters(const PSMVocoderParameters& params)
9574  {
9575  if (params.pitchShiftSemitones != parameters.pitchShiftSemitones)
9576  {
9577  setPitchShift(params.pitchShiftSemitones);
9578  }
9579 
9580  // --- save
9581  parameters = params;
9582  }
9583 
9584 protected:
9585  PSMVocoderParameters parameters;
9586  PhaseVocoder vocoder;
9587  double alphaStretchRatio = 1.0;
9588 
9589  // --- FFT is 4096 with 75% overlap
9590  const double hs = PSM_FFT_LEN / 4;
9591  double ha = PSM_FFT_LEN / 4;
9592  double phi[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { 0.0 };
9593  double psi[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { 0.0 };
9594 
9595  // --- for peak-locking
9596  BinData binData[PSM_FFT_LEN];
9597  BinData binDataPrevious[PSM_FFT_LEN];
9598 
9599  int peakBins[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { -1 };
9600  int peakBinsPrevious[PSM_FFT_LEN] = { -1 };
9601 
9602  double* windowBuff = nullptr;
9603  double* outputBuff = nullptr;
9604  double windowCorrection = 0.0;
9605  unsigned int outputBufferLength = 0;
9606 };
9607 
9608 // --- sample rate conversion
9609 //
9610 // --- supported conversion ratios - you can EASILY add more to this
9624 enum class rateConversionRatio { k2x, k4x };
9625 const unsigned int maxSamplingRatio = 4;
9626 
9636 inline unsigned int countForRatio(rateConversionRatio ratio)
9637 {
9638  if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k2x)
9639  return 2;
9640  else if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k4x || ratio == rateConversionRatio::k4x)
9641  return 4;
9642 
9643  return 0;
9644 }
9645 
9646 // --- get table pointer for built-in anti-aliasing LPFs
9658 inline double* getFilterIRTable(unsigned int FIRLength, rateConversionRatio ratio, unsigned int sampleRate)
9659 {
9660  // --- we only have built in filters for 44.1 and 48 kHz
9661  if (sampleRate != 44100 && sampleRate != 48000) return nullptr;
9662 
9663  // --- choose 2xtable
9664  if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k2x)
9665  {
9666  if (sampleRate == 44100)
9667  {
9668  if (FIRLength == 128)
9669  return &LPF128_882[0];
9670  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9671  return &LPF256_882[0];
9672  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9673  return &LPF512_882[0];
9674  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9675  return &LPF1024_882[0];
9676  }
9677  if (sampleRate == 48000)
9678  {
9679  if (FIRLength == 128)
9680  return &LPF128_96[0];
9681  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9682  return &LPF256_96[0];
9683  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9684  return &LPF512_96[0];
9685  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9686  return &LPF1024_96[0];
9687  }
9688  }
9689 
9690  // --- choose 4xtable
9691  if (ratio == rateConversionRatio::k4x)
9692  {
9693  if (sampleRate == 44100)
9694  {
9695  if (FIRLength == 128)
9696  return &LPF128_1764[0];
9697  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9698  return &LPF256_1764[0];
9699  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9700  return &LPF512_1764[0];
9701  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9702  return &LPF1024_1764[0];
9703  }
9704  if (sampleRate == 48000)
9705  {
9706  if (FIRLength == 128)
9707  return &LPF128_192[0];
9708  else if (FIRLength == 256)
9709  return &LPF256_192[0];
9710  else if (FIRLength == 512)
9711  return &LPF512_192[0];
9712  else if (FIRLength == 1024)
9713  return &LPF1024_192[0];
9714  }
9715  }
9716  return nullptr;
9717 }
9718 
9719 // --- get table pointer for built-in anti-aliasing LPFs
9731 inline double** decomposeFilter(double* filterIR, unsigned int FIRLength, unsigned int ratio)
9732 {
9733  unsigned int subBandLength = FIRLength / ratio;
9734  double ** polyFilterSet = new double*[ratio];
9735  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ratio; i++)
9736  {
9737  double* polyFilter = new double[subBandLength];
9738  polyFilterSet[i] = polyFilter;
9739  }
9740 
9741  int m = 0;
9742  for (int i = 0; i < subBandLength; i++)
9743  {
9744  for (int j = ratio - 1; j >= 0; j--)
9745  {
9746  double* polyFilter = polyFilterSet[j];
9747  polyFilter[i] = filterIR[m++];
9748  }
9749  }
9750 
9751  return polyFilterSet;
9752 }
9753 
9765 struct InterpolatorOutput
9766 {
9767  InterpolatorOutput() {}
9768  double audioData[maxSamplingRatio] = { 0.0 };
9769  unsigned int count = maxSamplingRatio;
9770 };
9771 
9772 
9790 class Interpolator
9791 {
9792 public:
9793  Interpolator() { } /* C-TOR */
9794  ~Interpolator() { } /* D-TOR */
9795 
9803  inline void initialize(unsigned int _FIRLength, rateConversionRatio _ratio, unsigned int _sampleRate, bool _polyphase = true)
9804  {
9805  polyphase = _polyphase;
9806  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
9807  FIRLength = _FIRLength;
9808  ratio = _ratio;
9809  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9810  unsigned int subBandLength = FIRLength / count;
9811 
9812  // --- straight SRC, no polyphase
9813  convolver.initialize(FIRLength);
9814 
9815  // --- set filterIR from built-in set - user can always override this!
9816  double* filterTable = getFilterIRTable(FIRLength, ratio, sampleRate);
9817  if (!filterTable) return;
9818  convolver.setFilterIR(filterTable);
9819 
9820  if (!polyphase) return;
9821 
9822  // --- decompose filter
9823  double** polyPhaseFilters = decomposeFilter(filterTable, FIRLength, count);
9824  if (!polyPhaseFilters)
9825  {
9826  polyphase = false;
9827  return;
9828  }
9829 
9830  // --- set the individual polyphase filter IRs on the convolvers
9831  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9832  {
9833  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].initialize(subBandLength);
9834  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].setFilterIR(polyPhaseFilters[i]);
9835  delete[] polyPhaseFilters[i];
9836  }
9837 
9838  delete[] polyPhaseFilters;
9839  }
9840 
9842  inline InterpolatorOutput interpolateAudio(double xn)
9843  {
9844  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9845 
9846  // --- setup output
9847  InterpolatorOutput output;
9848  output.count = count;
9849 
9850  // --- interpolators need the amp correction
9851  double ampCorrection = double(count);
9852 
9853  // --- polyphase uses "backwards" indexing for interpolator; see book
9854  int m = count-1;
9855  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9856  {
9857  if (!polyphase)
9858  output.audioData[i] = i == 0 ? ampCorrection*convolver.processAudioSample(xn) : ampCorrection*convolver.processAudioSample(0.0);
9859  else
9860  output.audioData[i] = ampCorrection*polyPhaseConvolvers[m--].processAudioSample(xn);
9861  }
9862  return output;
9863  }
9864 
9865 protected:
9866  // --- for straight, non-polyphase
9867  FastConvolver convolver;
9868 
9869  // --- we save these for future expansion, currently only sparsely used
9870  unsigned int sampleRate = 44100;
9871  unsigned int FIRLength = 256;
9872  rateConversionRatio ratio = rateConversionRatio::k2x;
9873 
9874  // --- polyphase: 4x is max right now
9875  bool polyphase = true;
9876  FastConvolver polyPhaseConvolvers[maxSamplingRatio];
9877 };
9878 
9890 struct DecimatorInput
9891 {
9892  DecimatorInput() {}
9893  double audioData[maxSamplingRatio] = { 0.0 };
9894  unsigned int count = maxSamplingRatio;
9895 };
9896 
9915 class Decimator
9916 {
9917 public:
9918  Decimator() { } /* C-TOR */
9919  ~Decimator() { } /* D-TOR */
9920 
9928  inline void initialize(unsigned int _FIRLength, rateConversionRatio _ratio, unsigned int _sampleRate, bool _polyphase = true)
9929  {
9930  polyphase = _polyphase;
9931  sampleRate = _sampleRate;
9932  FIRLength = _FIRLength;
9933  ratio = _ratio;
9934  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9935  unsigned int subBandLength = FIRLength / count;
9936 
9937  // --- straight SRC, no polyphase
9938  convolver.initialize(FIRLength);
9939 
9940  // --- set filterIR from built-in set - user can always override this!
9941  double* filterTable = getFilterIRTable(FIRLength, ratio, sampleRate);
9942  if (!filterTable) return;
9943  convolver.setFilterIR(filterTable);
9944 
9945  if (!polyphase) return;
9946 
9947  // --- decompose filter
9948  double** polyPhaseFilters = decomposeFilter(filterTable, FIRLength, count);
9949  if (!polyPhaseFilters)
9950  {
9951  polyphase = false;
9952  return;
9953  }
9954 
9955  // --- set the individual polyphase filter IRs on the convolvers
9956  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9957  {
9958  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].initialize(subBandLength);
9959  polyPhaseConvolvers[i].setFilterIR(polyPhaseFilters[i]);
9960  delete[] polyPhaseFilters[i];
9961  }
9962 
9963  delete[] polyPhaseFilters;
9964  }
9965 
9967  inline double decimateAudio(DecimatorInput data)
9968  {
9969  unsigned int count = countForRatio(ratio);
9970 
9971  // --- setup output
9972  double output = 0.0;
9973 
9974  // --- polyphase uses "forwards" indexing for decimator; see book
9975  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
9976  {
9977  if (!polyphase) // overwrites output; only the last output is saved
9978  output = convolver.processAudioSample(data.audioData[i]);
9979  else
9980  output += polyPhaseConvolvers[i].processAudioSample(data.audioData[i]);
9981  }
9982  return output;
9983  }
9984 
9985 protected:
9986  // --- for straight, non-polyphase
9987  FastConvolver convolver;
9988 
9989  // --- we save these for future expansion, currently only sparsely used
9990  unsigned int sampleRate = 44100;
9991  unsigned int FIRLength = 256;
9992  rateConversionRatio ratio = rateConversionRatio::k2x;
9993 
9994  // --- polyphase: 4x is max right now
9995  bool polyphase = true;
9996  FastConvolver polyPhaseConvolvers[maxSamplingRatio];
9997 };
9998

PhaseShifterParameters::quadPhaseLFO

TransitionBandData
